sub_title: Technical Advisor at FIGIEFA - Automotive Aftermarket Distributors
summary:
An ambitious MBA graduate and a techno-functional enthusiast who is passionate about new technologies and technological innovations. I enjoy dealing with strategy, market analysis and developing smart and need-based customer solutions across domains of my interest.

Functional Skills:
-Business Strategy
-Management Consulting
-IT Consulting
-Business development
-Project Management
-Marketing Strategy
-Event Management

IT Skills:
-C++
-Core Java/J2EE
-Oracle–PLSQL/SQL
-BI reporting 
-Perl scripting
-Microsoft Office Suite
-Microsoft Project

I have always striven to excel in whatever ventures I am involved in- whether its academics, cultural, activities or sports. While in school I dreamed of pursuing an undergraduate degree in engineering and while in college I dreamed of being my own boss. This kind of future-oriented mindset has driven me to look for different opportunities and move forward in my life. I am someone who firmly believes that:"Successful people are not the ones who get bogged down by the stones of failure which life throws at them but are those who make a fort out of it."

projects.title: Heineken - Improving effectiveness of Corporate Social Responsibility Reporting and incorporating inclusive sustainable business
projects.description:
The main aim of this project was to suggest to the Head of Sustainability of Heineken and other key stakeholders on how to improve the effectiveness of their CSR reporting especially in terms of what more needs to be included to communicate the message clearly, what could be avoided and how people perceive the CSR reports in general.
At the same time, we also suggested innovative ideas to Heineken to 
(i) Educate on underage drinking via the mobile app
(ii) BlipTaxi App Feature- Reduce drunken driving instances by collaborating with community taxi services
(iii)BlipCash App Feature- Payment system via the Heineken Mobile App

projects.title: Google I&I(Information and Innovation Project)
projects.description:
Designed a comprehensive business solution for TBI, a Dutch Construction Company, focusing on the innovation aspect and how Google products and services could help in their transformation. The business solution focused on 4 main aspects:
•	Analytics -  Using of Predictive Analysis to avoid field accident and Usage of Small Data in Construction industry.
•	Augmented reality and IKEA concept- How AR, along with Google products and services, could help the future construction industry in terms of process improvement, construction project management and sales and marketing. 
•	Monitoring Students in educational institutions - Processes to identify and train young future talent pools who could be helpful for the construction industry.
•	Self Tuning Enterprises - Organisational changes that TBI could implement with the help of google services to become a self-tuning enterprise

projects.title: Solaris Administration Tool
projects.description: Solaris operating system developed by Sun microsystems is one of the most flexible and powerful backend system used all over the world. Solaris is a text-based interface system except for IBM, which has developed its own GUI interface for Solaris administration purpose. As far now there is no user-friendly GUI interface available for Solaris. Solaris Administration Tool provides a solution for this issue. This product could be used by any person to perform the administration tasks in Solaris and implementing it in a small scale sector. The product covers the implementation of the basic administration tasks and also few other advanced features of the Solaris (NIS, NFS etc.). The final product is a java GUI application which runs on a windows machine connected to Telnet/SSH at the background which communicates to the server. This sophisticated tool creates an easy way of using Solaris and performing our tasks in a better way.

profile_positions.title: Business Development Trainee- Car Telematics

profile_positions.description:
3 years experience in IBM’s network monitoring, reporting and fault management suite ‘NETCOOL’ for client TELSTRA. Part of BI (Business Intelligence) team in the IT project management domain.

Requirement Elicitation
•	Developed IA (Impact Assessment) documents, mapping the business requirements into software solutions through client meetings/ interviews.
•	High-level solution design, identified project costs and drafted ¬project plans for multiple Netcool/ Telstra Global (cross team) projects.

KM (Knowledge Management)/ Mentorship
•	KMail anchor-Responsible for scheduling and managing ‘K-Mails’ with the entire team, to ensure individual learning is effectively shared across the team.
•	Organized KT (Knowledge Transfer) session for new hires, assumed the position of offshore lead for new hires to facilitate their smooth transition to project activities.

BI application management
•	Application Management activities supporting Business development and process improvement and optimization activities of the client by processing large volumes of network data.
•	Co-coordinated and managed project performance /project progress meetings and weekly status reporting of projects with client representatives.
•	BI application developer/SME (Subject Matter Expert) – Implemented functionalities (using agile methods) like dashboard creation, Alarm (fault) identification and reporting, by collaborating and supporting database experts. 
•	Working across all phases of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) with on-time deployment of projects.
•	BI Tester/Offshore test lead in NAB (National Aggregation Broadband) and CNS-DI (cross team) project. 
•	Designed ST (System testing), SIT (System Integration Testing) and UAT (User Acceptance Testing) test scenarios and comprehensively tested the required subsystem as an end consumer.
